description.S2: He wants a special cache of anthrocillin,
description.S3: found in the Emerald Vale Community Center.
description.S4: Esther confronted you outside of Abernathy's house,
description.S5: and suggested that you should give the medicine to her instead of Abernathy.

blurb.B1: You can find the Experimental Anthrocillin in the Emerald Vale Community Center inside the medical area.
blurb.B2: You'll need the Medical Bay key to get in there,
blurb.B3: which can be found on one of the Marauders.
blurb.B4: Once you obtain it you can give it to Esther or Martin.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I appreciate the company and all, but you really ought to leave. You don't want to be seen around me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why not?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I go where I want.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll leave you be.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Because I'm sick. You don't want to associate with people in the sick house. We're not worth your time.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm in about as much trouble as I can be. No reason you ought to be tarnished by association. People are gonna talk.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't mind.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why? What's going on here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You make it sound like I'm being watched.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm leaving.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I don't know which company you work for. But if it's Spacer's Choice, boss can still write you up for fraternizing with an incompetent worker.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Maybe you don't know this, but there's a real simple reason you don't talk to the plagued. You don't want what we've got.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've got some training. I could take a look at you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm not worried. I don't get sick often.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I should go.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Don't - please. I could get into a lot of trouble.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You obviously need help.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What kind of trouble?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If you insist.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: That's kind of you to say, I suppose. But I don't need help. What I need is to understand my own folly.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Company always tells us - weak spirits lead to weak bodies. If I didn't want to fall sick with plague, maybe I should've worked harder. Maybe I should've taken more pride in my work.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's ridiculous. You can't blame yourself because you fell sick.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: It's a little late for that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll leave you be.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I really wish you wouldn't say those sorts of things. I told you once already. People could be listening.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm feeling a touch faint. If you don't mind, I'd like to be alone for a spell.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I don't want any trouble.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Esther said she was going to distribute some medicine to those who needed it.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Esther's got medication? How? Did the boss get a new shipment? I'm sorry, it's just - I thought we couldn't spare the medicine.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: No, I'm sorry. I can't accept help from Esther. If I deserved treatment, I wouldn't be here.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're wrong.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Suit yourself.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Why?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're not doing yourself any favors, punishing yourself like this.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I heard the company's looking to promote healthy workers.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Because I said so. Stop moping and take the damned medicine.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: That is exactly what I have been doing. Not my place to dole out punishment. Not even against myself.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: All right, you made your point. If Esther offers to treat me, I won't turn her down.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I didn't know that. I guess the best thing I can do for Edgewater is get healthy. Dead workers can't do much except fill a grave.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I appreciate you telling me, leastways.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm glad you see things my way. And not for nothing, but I appreciate you giving me the time of day.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: People trouble. Lazy worker like me getting special treatment from some out-of-town physicker like you? People will talk.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Afraid I do. Don't sit right with me, is all. Good-for-nothing like me, getting special treatment from some fancy outsider.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: It's not the plague you gotta worry about catching. It's my attitude.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Figured it was obvious. I got sick. Couldn't get better on my own. Got moved here for everyone's sake.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: The walls talk, is all. We all got sights on each other. Any of us breaks company protocol, boss is gonna hear about it from six different mouths.

dialog.speaker: RosemaryKwan (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hey, keep it down. That kind of talk's bound to put sights on the both of us.
